title: Mark Zuckerberg was interviewed by FTC over two days as part of antitrust probe
text: Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg testified over the course of two days this week before the Federal Trade Commission as part of its antitrust investigation into the company's business practices, according to a person familiar with the matter.

title: Facebook CEO Zuckerberg testified to FTC as part of antitrust probe
text: CNBC's Bertha Coombs reports that Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg testified two days this week to the FTC as part of an antitrust probe into Big-Tech.

title: Zuckerberg testifies before FTC as part of antitrust probe
text: Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg this week testified at a Federal Trade Commission investigative hearing related to the federal agency's antitrust investigation into the tech company.

title: Facebook confirms Zuckerberg interviewed in FTC investigation
text: Facebook confirmed chief executive Mark Zuckerberg was interviewed earlier this week at a Federal Trade Commission (FTC) investigative hearing.

title: Facebook Gets Preliminary Approval To Settle Facial Recognition Lawsuit
text: Facebook allegedly violated an Illinois law requires companies collecting biometric data to obtain prior consent from consumers.

title: Facebook is quietly pressuring its independent fact-checkers to change their rulings
text:
As Facebook struggles with waves of misinformation, the company’s political and business concerns are influencing its fact-checking policies. 
When Mark Zuckerberg went to Washington for a rare, three-day charm tour last September, his schedule featured behind-closed-doors lunches, dinner with President Trump and Peter Thiel, and one-on-ones with lawmakers who, among other things, wanted to talk about a video on Facebook.

title: Facebook Gets Initial Court Approval To Settle Biometrics Privacy Lawsuit For $650M
text: Facebook Inc. (NASDAQ: FB) received a federal court's preliminary approval for a $650 million settlement related to a lawsuit that alleged the social media giant gathered biometric data of millions of its users without their consent, Reuters reported Wednesday.

title: Facebook Says It Acted Against QAnon, Antifa, And Others That 'Celebrated Violent Acts'
text: Facebook Inc (NASDAQ: FB) said Wednesday it acted against groups such as QAnon and antifa, movements that it said “celebrated” violent acts.
